t: Joel 1
The Devastation of Locusts
The*p word of the Lord*s that came to Joel, the son of Pethuel:
Hear*pn this, O elders, And*ln listen, all inhabitants of the land. Has*ln anything*i like*i this happened in your days Or*ln in your fathers’ days?
Tell*ln your sons about it, And*ln let*i your sons tell*i their sons, And*ln their sons the next generation.

What*ln the gnawing locust has left, the swarming locust has eaten; And*ln what the swarming locust has left, the creeping locust has eaten; And*ln what the creeping locust has left, the stripping locust has eaten.
Awake,*ln drunkards, and weep; And*ln wail, all you wine drinkers, On*ln account of the sweet wine That*ln is cut off from your mouth.
For*ln a nation has invaded my land, Mighty*ln and without number; Its*ln teeth are the teeth of a lion, And*ln it has the fangs of a lioness.
It*ln has made my vine a waste And*ln my fig tree splinters. It*ln has stripped them bare and cast them*i away; Their*ln branches have become white.
Wail*ln like a virgin girded with sackcloth For*ln the bridegroom of her youth.
The*ln grain offering and the drink offering are cut off From*ln the house of the Lord.*s The*ln priests mourn, The*ln ministers of the Lord.*s
The*ln field is ruined, The*ln land mourns; For*ln the grain is ruined, The*ln new wine dries up, Fresh*ln oil fails.
Be*ln ashamed, O farmers, Wail,*ln O vinedressers, For*ln the wheat and the barley; Because*ln the harvest of the field is destroyed.
The*ln vine dries up And*ln the fig tree fails; The*ln pomegranate, the palm also, and the apple tree, All*ln the trees of the field dry up. Indeed,*ln rejoicing dries up From*ln the sons of men.

Gird*ln yourselves with*i sackcloth*i And*ln lament, O priests; Wail,*ln O ministers of the altar! Come,*ln spend the night in sackcloth O*ln ministers of my God, For*ln the grain offering and the drink offering Are*ln withheld from the house of your God.
Starvation and Drought
Consecrate*pn a fast, Proclaim*ln a solemn assembly; Gather*ln the elders And*iln all the inhabitants of the land To*ln the house of the Lord*s your God, And*ln cry out to the Lord.*s
Alas*ln for the day! For*ln the day of the Lord*s is near, And*ln it will come as destruction from the Almighty.
Has*ln not food been cut off before our eyes, Gladness*ln and joy from the house of our God?
The*ln seeds shrivel under their clods; The*ln storehouses are desolate, The*ln barns are torn down, For*ln the grain is dried up.
How*ln the beasts groan! The*ln herds of cattle wander aimlessly Because*ln there is no pasture for them; Even*ln the flocks of sheep suffer.
To*ln You, O Lord,*s I cry; For*ln fire has devoured the pastures of the wilderness And*ln the flame has burned up all the trees of the field.
Even*ln the beasts of the field pant for You; For*ln the water brooks are dried up And*ln fire has devoured the pastures of the wilderness.
Joel 2
The Terrible Visitation
Blow*pn a trumpet in Zion, And*ln sound an alarm on My holy mountain! Let*ln all the inhabitants of the land tremble, For*ln the day of the Lord*s is coming; Surely*ln it is near,

A*ln day of darkness and gloom, A*ln day of clouds and thick darkness. As*ln the dawn is spread over the mountains, So*iln there is a great and mighty people; There*ln has never been anything*i like it, Nor*ln will there be again after it To*ln the years of many generations.
A*ln fire consumes before them And*ln behind them a flame burns. The*ln land is like the garden of Eden before them But*ln a desolate wilderness behind them, And*ln nothing at all escapes them.
Their*ln appearance is like the appearance of horses; And*ln like war horses, so they run.
With*ln a noise as of chariots They*ln leap on the tops of the mountains, Like*ln the crackling of a flame of fire consuming the stubble, Like*ln a mighty people arranged for battle.
Before*ln them the people are in anguish; All*ln faces turn pale.
They*ln run like mighty men, They*ln climb the wall like soldiers; And*ln they each march in line, Nor*ln do they deviate from their paths.
They*ln do not crowd each other, They*ln march everyone in his path; When*ln they burst through the defenses, They*ln do not break ranks.
They*ln rush on the city, They*ln run on the wall; They*ln climb into the houses, They*ln enter through the windows like a thief.
Before*ln them the earth quakes, The*ln heavens tremble, The*ln sun and the moon grow dark And*ln the stars lose their brightness.

The*ln Lord*s utters His voice before His army; Surely*ln His camp is very great, For*ln strong is he who carries out His word. The*ln day of the Lord*s is indeed great and very awesome, And*ln who can endure it?
“Yet*ln even now,” declares the Lord,*s “Return*ln to Me with all your heart, And*ln with fasting, weeping and mourning;
And*ln rend your heart and not your garments.” Now*ln return to the Lord*s your God, For*ln He is gracious and compassionate, Slow*ln to anger, abounding in lovingkindness And*ln relenting of evil.
Who*ln knows whether He will not*i turn and relent And*ln leave a blessing behind Him, Even*iln a grain offering and a drink offering For*ln the Lord*s your God?
Blow*ln a trumpet in Zion, Consecrate*ln a fast, proclaim a solemn assembly,

Gather*ln the people, sanctify the congregation, Assemble*ln the elders, Gather*ln the children and the nursing infants. Let*ln the bridegroom come out of his room And*ln the bride out of her bridal*i chamber.

Let*ln the priests, the Lord’s*s ministers, Weep*ln between the porch and the altar, And*ln let them say, “Spare Your people, O Lord,*s And*ln do not make Your inheritance a reproach, A*ln byword among the nations. Why*ln should they among the peoples say, ‘Where*ln is their God?’ ”
Deliverance Promised
Then*pn the Lord*s will be zealous for His land And*ln will have pity on His people.

The*ln Lord*s will answer and say to His people, “Behold,*ln I am going to send you grain, new wine and oil, And*ln you will be satisfied in*i full*i with them; And*ln I will never again make you a reproach among the nations.

But*ln I will remove the northern army*i far from you, And*ln I will drive it into a parched and desolate land, And*ln its vanguard into the eastern sea, And*ln its rear guard into the western sea. And*ln its stench will arise and its foul smell will come up, For*ln it has done great things.”
Do*ln not fear, O land, rejoice and be glad, For*ln the Lord*s has done great things.
Do*ln not fear, beasts of the field, For*ln the pastures of the wilderness have turned green, For*ln the tree has borne its fruit, The*ln fig tree and the vine have yielded in full.

So*ln rejoice, O sons of Zion, And*ln be glad in the Lord*s your God; For*ln He has given you the early rain for your*i vindication. And*ln He has poured down for you the rain, The*ln early and latter rain as before.
The*ln threshing floors will be full of grain, And*ln the vats will overflow with the new wine and oil.
“Then*ln I will make up to you for the years That*ln the swarming locust has eaten, The*ln creeping locust, the stripping locust and the gnawing locust, My*ln great army which I sent among you.
You*ln will have plenty to eat and be satisfied And*ln praise the name of the Lord*s your God, Who*ln has dealt wondrously with you; Then*ln My people will never be put to shame.
Thus*ln you will know that I am in the midst of Israel, And*ln that I am the Lord*s your God, And*ln there is no other; And*ln My people will never be put to shame.
The Promise of the Spirit

“It*pn will come about after this That*ln I will pour out My Spirit on all mankind; And*ln your sons and daughters will prophesy, Your*ln old men will dream dreams, Your*ln young men will see visions.
Even*ln on the male and female servants I*ln will pour out My Spirit in those days.
The Day of the Lord
I*pn will display wonders in the sky and on the earth, Blood,*ln fire and columns of smoke.
The*ln sun will be turned into darkness And*ln the moon into blood Before*ln the great and awesome day of the Lord*s comes.

And*ln it will come about that whoever calls on the name of the Lord*s Will*ln be delivered; For*ln on Mount Zion and in Jerusalem There*ln will be those who escape, As*ln the Lord*s has said, Even*ln among the survivors whom the Lord*s calls.
Joel 3
The Nations Will Be Judged
“For*pn behold, in those days and at that time, When*ln I restore the fortunes of Judah and Jerusalem,

I*ln will gather all the nations And*ln bring them down to the valley of Jehoshaphat. Then*ln I will enter into judgment with them there On*ln behalf of My people and My inheritance, Israel, Whom*ln they have scattered among the nations; And*ln they have divided up My land.
They*ln have also cast lots for My people, Traded*ln a boy for a harlot And*ln sold a girl for wine that they may drink.

Moreover,*p what are you to Me, O Tyre, Sidon and all the regions of Philistia? Are you rendering Me a recompense? But if you do recompense Me, swiftly and speedily I will return your recompense on your head.
Since you have taken My silver and My gold, brought My precious treasures to your temples,
and sold the sons of Judah and Jerusalem to the Greeks in order to remove them far from their territory,
behold, I am going to arouse them from the place where you have sold them, and return your recompense on your head.
Also I will sell your sons and your daughters into the hand of the sons of Judah, and they will sell them to the Sabeans, to a distant nation,” for the Lord*s has spoken.
Proclaim*pn this among the nations: Prepare*ln a war; rouse the mighty men! Let*ln all the soldiers draw near, let them come up!
Beat*ln your plowshares into swords And*ln your pruning hooks into spears; Let*ln the weak say, “I am a mighty man.”
Hasten*ln and come, all you surrounding nations, And*ln gather yourselves there. Bring*ln down, O Lord,*s Your mighty ones.
Let*ln the nations be aroused And*ln come up to the valley of Jehoshaphat, For*ln there I will sit to judge All*ln the surrounding nations.
Put*ln in the sickle, for the harvest is ripe. Come,*ln tread, for the wine press is full; The*ln vats overflow, for their wickedness is great.
Multitudes,*ln multitudes in the valley of decision! For*ln the day of the Lord*s is near in the valley of decision.
The*ln sun and moon grow dark And*ln the stars lose their brightness.
The*ln Lord*s roars from Zion And*ln utters His voice from Jerusalem, And*ln the heavens and the earth tremble. But*ln the Lord*s is a refuge for His people And*ln a stronghold to the sons of Israel.
Then*ln you will know that I am the Lord*s your God, Dwelling*ln in Zion, My holy mountain. So*ln Jerusalem will be holy, And*ln strangers will pass through it no more.
Judah Will Be Blessed

And*pn in that day The*ln mountains will drip with sweet wine, And*ln the hills will flow with milk, And*ln all the brooks of Judah will flow with water; And*ln a spring will go out from the house of the Lord*s To*ln water the valley of Shittim.
Egypt*ln will become a waste, And*ln Edom will become a desolate wilderness, Because*ln of the violence done to the sons of Judah, In*ln whose land they have shed innocent blood.
But*ln Judah will be inhabited forever And*ln Jerusalem for all generations.
And*ln I will avenge their blood which I have not avenged, For*ln the Lord*s dwells in Zion.
